July 1996 was the seventh month of that leap year. The month, which began on a Monday, ended on a Wednesday after 31 days.

Portal:Current events[edit]

Current events of July 1, 1996 (1996-07-01) (Monday) edit history watch
  • The Northern Territory in Australia legalises voluntary euthanasia.
  • German orthography reform of 1996 agreed internationally.
Current events of July 2, 1996 (1996-07-02) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • In Los Angeles, Lyle and Erik Menendez are sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole.
Current events of July 3, 1996 (1996-07-03) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • Boris Yeltsin is re-elected as President of Russia after the second round of elections.
Current events of July 5, 1996 (1996-07-05) (Friday) edit history watch
  • Dolly the sheep, the first mammal to be successfully cloned from an adult cell, is born at the Roslin Institute in Midlothian, Scotland, UK.
Current events of July 8, 1996 (1996-07-08) (Monday) edit history watch
  • Martina Hingis becomes the youngest person in history (aged 15 years and 282 days) to win at Wimbledon in the Ladies' Doubles event.
Current events of July 10, 1996 (1996-07-10) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • Harriet the Spy, the first film made by Nickelodeon Movies, is released in cinemas.
Current events of July 11, 1996 (1996-07-11) (Thursday) edit history watch
  • Arrest warrants are issued for Bosnian Serb war criminals Radovan Karadžić and Ratko Mladić by the Russell Tribunal in The Hague.
Current events of July 12, 1996 (1996-07-12) (Friday) edit history watch
  • Hurricane Bertha: made landfall in North Carolina as a Category 2 storm, causing $270,000,000 in damage ($446 million in present-day terms[1]) to the United States and its possessions and many indirect deaths.
Current events of July 13, 1996 (1996-07-13) (Saturday) edit history watch
  • A Republican Sinn Féin bomb explodes outside of a hotel in Enniskillen, Northern Ireland, disrupting a wedding reception and injuring seventeen people.
Current events of July 16, 1996 (1996-07-16) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • An outbreak of E. coli food poisoning in Japan results in 6,000 children being ill, including two deaths, after a group of school children eat contaminated lunches.
Current events of July 17, 1996 (1996-07-17) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • The Community of Portuguese Language Countries (Comunidade dos Países de Língua Portuguesa) is constituted.
  • Paris and Rome-bound TWA Flight 800 (Boeing 747) explodes off the coast of Long Island, New York, killing all 230 people on board.
  • Joe Klein admits that he is "Anonymous", the author of Primary Colors.
Current events of July 18, 1996 (1996-07-18) (Thursday) edit history watch
  • Howard Hughes is sentenced to life imprisonment at Chester Crown Court for the rape and murder of 7-year-old Sophie Hook at Llandudno twelve months previously. The trial judge recommends that Hughes, 31, should never be released. However, the Home Secretary set his minimum term at 50 years in 2002, meaning he is eligible for parole in 2046.
Current events of July 19, 1996 (1996-07-19) (Friday) edit history watch
  • An F3 tornado 5.5 miles (8.9 km) away from the Westminster, Maryland city center injures three people and causes $5,000,000 in damages ($8.25 million in present-day terms[1]).[2]
  • The 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, United States, begin.
  • Bosnian Serb President Radovan Karadžić resigns from public office in Republika Srpska after being indicted for war crimes.
Current events of July 21, 1996 (1996-07-21) (Sunday) edit history watch
  • The Saguenay Flood, one of Canada's most costly natural disasters, is caused by flooding on the Saguenay River in Quebec.
Current events of July 24, 1996 (1996-07-24) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • The Dehiwala train bombing kills 56 commuters outside Colombo.
Current events of July 25, 1996 (1996-07-25) (Thursday) edit history watch
  • The Tutsi-led Burundian army performs a coup and reinstalls previous president Pierre Buyoya, ousting current president Sylvestre Ntibantunganya.
Current events of July 27, 1996 (1996-07-27) (Saturday) edit history watch
  • The Centennial Olympic Park bombing at the 1996 Summer Olympics kills one person and injures 111.
Current events of July 29, 1996 (1996-07-29) (Monday) edit history watch
  • The child protection portion of the Communications Decency Act (1996) is struck down as too broad by a U.S. federal court.
◀July 1996▶
